meanings.definition: To scream louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She was outscreaming her brother during the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm was so loud that it was hard to outscream it.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy tried outscreaming the big dog, but it was no use.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement outscreamed all the other noises in the room.
meanings.sent5: The singer's powerful voice outscreamed the cheering crowd.

meanings.sent1: The fireworks were outscreaming the music at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the ambulance outscreaming the traffic caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock seemed to be outscreaming the entire neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The silence in the library was outscreamed by the sudden laughter of a student.
meanings.sent5: The roar of the lion outscreamed all other sounds in the jungle.
